'''Frank Phillip Sibley''' (born 4 December 1947 in [[Uxbridge]]) is an English former [[association football|footballer]] and a member of the [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|QPR]] double winning side that captured both the [[Football League Division Three|Third Division]] Championship in 1966–67 and the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] on 4 March 1967.

Sibley was the youngest player to play in the [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|QPR]] first team at the age of 15 on 3 September 1963 away to Aldershot in a League Cup tie.

He retired from playing early, at the age of 23, after suffering a knee injury. He joined the coaching staff at QPR, and later became manager. He was also manager of [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] in 1979.

He is currently chief scout for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].
